TextView.android:text: Allergic reactions usually happen quickly within a few minutes of exposure to an allergen. They can cause: • sneezing • a runny or blocked nose • red, itchy, watery eyes • wheezing and coughing • a red, itchy rash • worsening of asthma or eczema symptoms Most allergic reactions are mild, but occasionally a severe reaction called anaphylaxis or anaphylactic shock can occur. This is a medical emergency and needs urgent treatment.
